taskOptions.description: Only reads as long as this will be used as 'seeds' for the draft assembly. (Shorter reads will be used for correction and polishing, if they pass the dataset filters.) If '-1', then this will be calculated automatically, such that the total number of seed bases nearly equals GenomeLength*SeedCoverage.
taskOptions.name: Seed length cutoff

taskOptions.description: Approx. number of base pairs expected in the genome for the microbe plus plasmids. We choose many hidden settings automatically, based on this. Note: it's better to slightly overestimate than to underestimate the genome length to ensure good coverage across the genome.
taskOptions.name: Genome Length

taskOptions.description: Coverage requirement to select the seed length cutoff for assembly.
taskOptions.name: Coverage

taskOptions.description: A string which allows specification of advanced options. The options will parsed and injected into the workflow.
taskOptions.name: Advanced options

taskOptions.description: Cap value which should be set higher than the largest possible size of a plasmid in the input sample. The default value should work well in most cases.
taskOptions.name: Maximum plasmid size

taskOptions.description: By default SMRT Link will consolidate chunked mapped BAM files for viewing in IGV if the combined size is no more than 10 GB.  Setting this option to true will ignore the file size cutoff and always consolidate the BAM files.  Note that this is heavily I/O bound and may result in significantly longer runtimes.
taskOptions.name: Consolidate Mapped BAMs for IGV
